docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Oct. 7 (AP) -- Uruguay declared a state of siege today as 180,000 Government employes threatened a three-day general strike to start next Wednesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Oct. 7 (AP) -- Uruguay declared a state of siege today as 180,000 Government employes threatened a three-day general strike to start next Wednesday.
docs.abstract: Govt Council declares state of siege as 180,000 Govt workers plan 3-day gen strike; Zorrilla de San Martin charges climate of subversion exists

headline.main: Uruguay Put Under Siege; General Strike Is Near

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 9 -- Uruguay remained under a virtual state of siege this weekend as the Government moved to smother a threat of large-scale labor agitation.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 9 -- Uruguay remained under a virtual state of siege this weekend as the Government moved to smother a threat of large-scale labor agitation.

headline.main: URUGUAY IN VIRTUAL STATE OF SIEGE

docs.snippet: MOSCOW, Oct. 10 -- A senior Communist party official concerned with East European relations has been appointed editor in chief of Izvestia, the Government newspaper, according to informed sources.
docs.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Oct. 10 -- A senior Communist party official concerned with East European relations has been appointed editor in chief of Izvestia, the Government newspaper, according to informed sources.

headline.main: PARTY AIDE NAMED EDITOR OF IZVESTIA

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 11 -- "If ours were a rational country there is no doubt that we would have a coup d'etat any moment now," a high Uruguayan official said yesterday. "But Uruguay does not conform to the political patterns usually seen in...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 11 -- "If ours were a rational country there is no doubt that we would have a coup d'etat any moment now," a high Uruguayan official said yesterday. "But Uruguay does not conform to the political patterns usually seen in Latin America," he went on.
docs.abstract: Planned gen strike seen crucial test for Govt

headline.main: A Test for Uruguay; General Strike Is Due Tomorrow In the Midst of Economic Woes

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 14 -- The Government took the first major steps today to enforce censorship of the press and radio since it suspended constitutional guarantees last Thursday to smother a threat of labor violence.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 14 -- The Government took the first major steps today to enforce censorship of the press and radio since it suspended constitutional guarantees last Thursday to smother a threat of labor violence.
docs.abstract: Govt moves to enforce press and radio censorship under security decrees; closes pro-Cuban newspaper; 3 Colorado members of Council angered; gen strike in 2d day; Govt repts 323 jailed, some freed

headline.main: URUGUAY INVOKES NEWS CENSORSHIP; Seizes an Edition as Paper Calls for Wider Strike

byline.original: By HENRY RAYMONTSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 16 -- Confident that it has won the first round in a showdown with Uruguay's labor unions, the Government is moving to break a political impasse that has held up a vital economic recovery program for nearly six months.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 16 -- Confident that it has won the first round in a showdown with Uruguay's labor unions, the Government is moving to break a political impasse that has held up a vital economic recovery program for nearly six months.
docs.abstract: Strike for 48% wage hike falters; Natl Council sets 25% ceiling on increases, declares strikes illegal; labor leaders arrested

byline.original: By HENRY RAYMONTSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 18 -- The Communist leaders of the National Labor Convention are seeking a quick settlement of the convention's wage dispute with the Uruguayan Government.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Oct. 18 -- The Communist leaders of the National Labor Convention are seeking a quick settlement of the convention's wage dispute with the Uruguayan Government.
docs.abstract: Communist, leaders of Natl Labor Conv seek settlement with Govt following failure of strike
